name: HYATT house San Diego/Sorrento Mesa

reviews.title: Impressive.
reviews.text: OK. It's not the Woodfin. It's the Hyatt House. We stayed in the room right next to the elevator. I'm thinking noise all night. I was wrong. No noise. No bells. The room was huge. The size of a 1-bedroom apartment, with everything from a dishwasher and stove, to steak knives in the drawer. The beds were among the most comfortable I've had in any hotel in any price range. Breakfast buffet was great. Chaotic on Memorial Day weekend with families, but a very large assortment. I've never seen Miso soup at a breakfast buffet in a hotel. Free Parking. Free Internet. We'll be back.

reviews.title: Good location and amenities; rooms, reception service so-so
reviews.text: Got a room facing a wall, with weird noises, pre-renovation (no big-screen TV for me), staff refused to do anything about it saying they were full. Yeah, sure. Note that I was staying for two weeks, not a single night, yet my requests to move were refused every time.

reviews.title: Hyatt House now - good value suites - superb breakfast!!
reviews.text: Internet (even though wired) was pretty slow. Advertised printing in the "business center" near the lobby didn't work and receptionists did not know how to fix it. Receptionists were chatting with some local guy once while guests were waiting to be helped. Local newspapers would routinely run out.

reviews.title: Comfortable Stay
reviews.text: On the positive side, breakfasts were the best of comparable hotels in the area. A cook was regularly making omelettes on demand. I would also like to say a good word about the maintenance personnel - this is not a new place, and there were a few things broken in my room, and I made several requests that were quickly and efficiently dealt with. I wish the front desk staff in this hotel were as good as their maintenance staff.

reviews.title: Hyatt House (formerly Woodfin), excellent renovations
reviews.text: Remember that they sell their non-suites double rooms (with one queen bed unfortunately only! and no kitchenette/fridge) via priceline (2,5*) and hotwire (3,5*) for a real bargain esp. on the weekends.

I stayed here on a recent business trip. The location is great for many of the biotech companies in San Diego. Room was very comfortable. I was really impressed with how clean the room was. Bathroom too. Seemed to be a quiet hotel which I appreciate when traveling for business.
reviews.title: Nice place. Quiet and super clean.

reviews.text: The breakfast at the Oasis Grill in the hotel was delicious. Wait staff was quick and courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Value self contained suite

reviews.text: Under $100 per night via Expedia, in the middle of the Biotech area outside San Diego, $50 cab ride from the airport. Staff are great really helpful and friendly, suites are big, well looked after and kept clean, most seem to have a balcony too
reviews.title: Great rooms, especially at this price.

reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels for business this last year and this one was the best by far. Large room with a comfortable bed and it was nice having a kitchenette. The only issue I had was not being close to any stores so that the kitchen could be used (I did not have a car), but the hotel itself was nice, clean and the shuttle service was a nice perk.
reviews.title: Great place for extended stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very neat and clean place and very near to the business hub of San Diego. The place is a good choice if you are planning to be there for a longer duration. The hotel does provide a kitchenette along with the routine suite having LCD television, a reclibner etc. The view from the room, irrespective of which one you get or take is great.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: There was a bit of a hiccup at the start (through priceline you don't get an actual suite), but was able to upgrade to the suite for very little extra. Their breakfast is spectacular for a freebie (personalized omelet, yummy!), the rooms were spacious enough for us and our 2 little kids. Pool was only okay, but overall I was very impressed with what we got for the price! The location was great except if you want to go somewhere during the week at rush hour. It's in more of a business center, so getting onto the freeway at 5pm is a nightmare.
reviews.title: Now the Summerfield Suites, GREAT HOTEL!

reviews.text: I reserved a 1 room suite and when I arrived, I was told by manager that guest who stayed night before wanted another night when hotel was sold out and California law forbids them from removing someone from room. Relative is GM of a hotel told me that not law, that I was bumped because I was on travel agent discount rate and they were paying full rate stay for holiday weekend. I was bumped a handicap room and WAS NOT comped for it, instead half off room rate and points. I drove 500 miles and had guests who had to have their kids sleep on floor with no pillows!!! Also, kids running up and down halls and when I spoke to someone about it, I was told that security was there to handle it but I never saw security during my stay. Sunday breakfast room was understaffed. I saw manager( yes the same manager) working the floors along with maintenance personal. Coffee, plates and silverware were constantly being waited on. As an independent travel agent as well as a regular visitor to San Diego to see family, I couldn't possibly recumbent this hotel to family or clients. 1st impression is a bad one.
reviews.title: Mislead with information from Hyatt Sutterfield

reviews.text: Posting under Woodfin, because couldn't find a way to update property info. Per the letter in our room, this has been under Hyatt since late May.
reviews.title: THIS IS NOW THE SUMMERFIELD SUITES

reviews.text: Property was nice for an extended stay property. Room was huge, included as large of kitchen as I have seen at an extended stay hotel. Both the living room and bedroom were of an adequate size, again something you normally do not see at an extended stay property. Staff was extremely friendly and willing to help. Common areas were also nice. Pool was a little cool in temperature.
reviews.title: Hopefully, Hyatt will make improvements!

reviews.text: Now, if I worked for Hyatt corporate, I don't think I would be too happy. For being under Hyatt branding for three months, a temporary banner covers up the old branding, and stickers (on phone info card, etc) were visible everywhere. Seemed a little cheap that they couldn't replace these basic items with the new logo. Also, no guest info binder in room. I noticed in a few places that old information was posted. Example - a June HBO TV schedule in our room, and outside the breakfast area, a July calendar for breakfast offerings - in late August. Hyatt needs to get into this property sooner rather than later and enforce upgrading (newer more comfortable sofa, bed, etc). I am sure Hyatt is aware of these shortcomings, as the website offering for this hotel is anemic (very few pics, etc)
reviews.title: Family loved the location!
Perfect for an extended stay
reviews.text: I stayed for almost a week and really enjoyed the property. The newly remodeled courtyard rooms are very nice and quiet. The kitchenette was more than adequate for basic cooking and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly. The restaurant is a bit pricey but quality was excellent, and the complimentary breakfast service was great. I have no complaints whatsoever!

reviews.title: My Best Hotel Experience Eve
reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this hotel:

reviews.title: Hyatt House; Good Stay!
reviews.text: 1- The amenities

reviews.title: Nice Vacation Hotel
reviews.text: 2- Convenient location

reviews.title: Comfortable Stay at Hyatt Summerfield Suites
reviews.text: 3- Cleanliness

I stayed there with my husband and three boys ages 1,2 and 3 on July 1-2 , 2006. We were happy with this hotel and may stay here again. The staff was nice and friendly. The room was clean and spacious.We had the executive business room and iIt had a full size refrigerator, microwave, stove, cooking utensils, pots, dishes, glasses, cups, and dish washer. There was a king size bed in the room which we thought was really comfortable and a seperate lliving room with a sleeper sofa, 2 tvs and one with a dvd player. You can borrow dvd's downstairs in the lobby for free, 2 at a time but the dvd selection is very limited. There was only about 30 dvds to choose from and they were mostly the old movies like forest gump, charlie's angels and a few kids movies as well. They do have the disney channel which was nice for the kids so we mostly watched that instead. You can also request a crib which we did for my youngest son and you will get an evenflo portable crib. For some reason we had some trouble getting one into our room though. I had asked for one when I first checked in but an hour and a half later I had to call down to the front dest and ask them to bring one up. An hour later still no crib so this time I actually went down stairs to the lobby and told them that the crib has still not been delivered and this time finally they brought one to me about 10 minutes later. That was probably my only complaint about the hotel. The hotel was only about 15 to 30 minutes to all the places that we visited but it is located in a hotel/ business area so there is nothing within walking distance. No stores or anything nearby. I had to buy milk for my son and the closest place that sold it was at a shell gas station which was about 4 - 5 lights away. There is also a food court next to the gas station as well but most of the restaurants were closed on sunday. Only 3 were opened which was a japanese, thai and indian restaurant. In the other direction though which is about 1 or 2 lights down the street is a chili's restaurant and by the 805 freeway entrance is a mc donalds. The hotel does have a restaurant by the lobby but the menu is very limited. I wished that they had more items to choose from. Only a few items and nothing seems very interesting. Just salads, sandwiches and a few other things. We did order breakfast though, I had the omelet and my husband had the two eggs with bacon, and potato. Breakfast was alright but costed us about $20. On the internet it stated that the hotel has complimentary breakfast but they do not have one. I think they got rid of it because of the new restaurant that they have added to the hotel. They also have a small rectangle size pool and a hot tub. They also have a small area next to the lobby that sells drinks like champagne, beer, soda, snacks, and other stuff. Oh, and we had a room that faced a launching pad for hot air balloons. We had no idea and then on Sunday all of a sudden we looked out of our room and saw 7 hot air balloons. The kids got excited over that. I also thought that we got a great deal on the room too! We had payed $149 each night and that was on a holiday weekend! I had spent so many nights searching for the best deals on hotel and I was so happy to have found this one! It pays to do your research on prices because I had checked about 10 websites and they all had the same price for this hotel at $179 but only one website had it for the price that we payed. We saved about $80 for the two nights. I would recommend this hotel especially if you have kids because of the full kitchen and the size of the suite. I am so glad that we had stayed here!
reviews.title: overall happy with woodfin :)

reviews.text: Our family of six stayed here last July. We had a two bedroom suite and it was great. The price is very affordable especially when we would have been paying for two rooms at a regular hotel. It was our base for visiting the San Diego area. It is very convenient to many SD attractions and the Wildlife Park. The rooms were clean, although basic. We really enjoyed the included hot/cold breakfast. Overall, I would say that this is a very good value.
reviews.title: Great for Families

aka: Woodfin Suites Hotel, Sorrento Mesa Hotel San Diego
